hint: Filter dimension tables (item, date_dim) first before joining to large fact tables, push year filters into CTEs, and use CTEs to avoid recomputing identical logic across union branches.
Create separate CTEs for filtered date and item dimensions, then reuse them across all three sales channel joins to reduce redundant filtering and enable predicate pushdown.
Pre-join filtered dimensions with each fact table in dedicated CTEs, then union and aggregate; consider consolidating the two year aggregations into one pass to eliminate the self-join.
Split the union into separate CTEs per sales channel for targeted optimization, transform the self-join into a window function to get both years in one row, and explore alternative join structures.
